DataElement.preferredName: Normal Tissue Segment Finding Tissue Slide Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The status related to evidence of disease in the tissue section mounted on the normal tissue slide.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into one to three aliquots of non-neoplastic ("normal") adjacent tissue (as feasible) suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into one to three aliquots of non-neoplastic ("normal") adjacent tissue (as feasible) suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample with cellular composition and architectural patterns expected for the particular anatomic site in which it belongs. There is no evidence of abnormal cellular infiltrates or tumor mass formation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review CRF; applicable to all tumor types.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.: Include or hold; have within or as a component.: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.
Include or hold; have within or as a component.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

PermissibleValues.value: This slide is free of tumor

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.: There is no evidence of a tumor in the individual.

Concepts.definition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.
There is no evidence of a tumor in the individual.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.

ValueDomain.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set.  1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review CRFs.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CPTAC-PATH-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: FFPE QC:  Block ID (QC cassette ID) of the sample from which this slide was derived

ReferenceDocuments.name: CPTAC-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Identifiers are in format of C3Y-XXXXX- ZZ where Y is either N for NCI or L for Leidos, XXXXX is the case ID/kit id, ZZ equals the type of specimen.  There is a  pre-defined list of specimen types for CPTAC specimens.

DataElement.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElement.changeDescription: 8/17/21 jk added CM Path Rpt CSI. 7/12/21 jk added HNSCC Path Rpt CSI. 4/2/20 jk added CPTAC THCA Path Rev CSI.  1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/7/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review CRFs; applicable to all tumor types.
